item.title: Ice cores are cylinders of ice drilled from ice sheets and glaciers, essentially frozen time capsules. The dark band in this ice core from the West Antarctic Ice Sheet Divide is a layer of volcanic ash that settled on the ice approximately 21,000 years ago https://t.co/YMJumXWHya https://t.co/KcERmCsgFJ

item.title:
Last year, researchers investigated aging in cold-blooded tetrapods, revealing surprisingly little evidence of physical aging in several turtle species.
The results challenge the idea that senescence is an unescapable fate. Learn more on #WorldTurtleDay: https://t.co/CkSiXXo08Z https://t.co/DrBuurwXRz

item.title: In the illustrated animation above, the presynaptic axon (🟡) traverses multiple potential synapsing opportunities (🔴), ultimately forming a synaptic bond with just one (⚫️). What sets the black dendrite apart? Dive into our analysis using the #MICrONS dataset.

item.title: We used this dataset to train a “digital twin” model of the mouse visual cortex developed by Wang et al. (https://t.co/6K8KcG9JsY) that accurately predicts neuronal responses to arbitrary video stimuli and offers a comprehensive characterization of neural tuning.

item.title: We analyzed connected neurons against two anatomical controls: the 'same region control' (for connectivity rules at combined coarse axon trajectory and fine synaptic levels) and the ‘ADP control’ (for connectivity rules at the fine synaptic level alone). (HVA: higher visual area) https://t.co/wVaxiIjeBz

item.title: Our findings indicate that neuron pairs with higher signal correlation have a higher connection probability. This confirms the 'like-to-like' connectivity previously observed in V1 L2/3 and extends it across brain areas and cortical layers. https://t.co/oOtgxHDavU
item.description: Our findings indicate that neuron pairs with higher signal correlation have a higher connection probability. This confirms the 'like-to-like' connectivity previously observed in V1 L2/3 and extends it across brain areas and cortical layers. https://t.co/oOtgxHDavU

item.title: We separated neuronal tuning into a feature component (what neuron responds to) and a spatial component (where neuron receptive field is located). The feature component (top), but not the spatial component (bottom), predicted fine synaptic scale connectivity (🔴). https://t.co/NFYoJanV3Z
item.description: We separated neuronal tuning into a feature component (what neuron responds to) and a spatial component (where neuron receptive field is located). The feature component (top), but not the spatial component (bottom), predicted fine synaptic scale connectivity (🔴). https://t.co/NFYoJanV3Z
item.content:encoded: We separated neuronal tuning into a feature component (what neuron responds to) and a spatial component (where neuron receptive field is located). The feature component (top), but not the spatial component (bottom), predicted fine synaptic scale connectivity (🔴). https://t.co/NFYoJanV3Z

item.title: Note that above, both the feature component (top) and the spatial components (bottom) predicted connectivity at the coarse axon trajectory level (🔵), diverging from the fine synaptic scale (🔴).
item.description: Note that above, both the feature component (top) and the spatial components (bottom) predicted connectivity at the coarse axon trajectory level (🔵), diverging from the fine synaptic scale (🔴).

item.title: We next investigated whether the feature component (FW) offers additional information on connectivity beyond signal correlation (SC). We found FW and SC both independently contribute to predicting connectivity. Our preprint further discusses the intriguing potential implications. https://t.co/K6EF2yBqKd

item.title: By leveraging the #MICrONS dataset and digital twin models, we expanded and refined our understanding of synapse organization principles in the neocortex. Our work offers a first look at the structure-function relationship that can be discovered using this unprecedented dataset.
item.description: By leveraging the #MICrONS dataset and digital twin models, we expanded and refined our understanding of synapse organization principles in the neocortex. Our work offers a first look at the structure-function relationship that can be discovered using this unprecedented dataset.
item.content:encoded: By leveraging the #MICrONS dataset and digital twin models, we expanded and refined our understanding of synapse organization principles in the neocortex. Our work offers a first look at the structure-function relationship that can be discovered using this unprecedented dataset.

item.title:
@KordingLab @_fernando_rosas @ProfLaurenRoss It reminds of the difficulties in describing a gas in a box until 1850ish, because of the huge number of units (10^23 per mol)
Then, Maxwell and Boltzmann arrived, showing that microscopic information was not really needed to uncover some macroscopic features.
